SWAMP

By Thomas Gumbricht Google scholar Researchgate Mendeley Scopus Linkedin Orcid

The Sustainable Wetlands Adaptation and Mitigation Program (SWAMP) is a collaborative effort by the Center for International Forestry Research (CIFOR), the USDA Forest Service (USFS) and Oregon State University with support from the US Agency for International Development (USAID). SWAMP evolved from a multi-stakeholder exercise called the Tropical Wetlands Initiative for Climate Adaptation and Mitigation (TWINCAM), when the group was called to respond to a variety of challenges requested by stakeholders, ranging from local to global imperatives of sustainable wetlands management.

I have worked for SWAMP (TWINCAMP) as an independent researcher since 2012, focusing on mapping and monitoring of global pantropical wetlands and peatlands.

Journal articles

  • Gumbricht, T., Remote Sensing 2018. Detecting Trends in Wetland Extent from MODIS Derived Soil Moisture Estimates.
  • Gumbricht, T. et al., Global Change Biology 2017. An expert system model for mapping tropical wetlands and peatlands reveals South America as the largest contributor.

Refereed chapters

  • Gumbricht, T., Multitemporal Remote Sensing 2016. Soil Moisture Dynamics Estimated from MODIS Time Series Images.
  • Gumbricht, T., Remote Sensing of Wetlands: Applications and Advances 2015. Hybrid Mapping of pantropical wetlands from optical satellite images, hydrology and geomorphology.

Institutional reports

  • Gumbricht, T., CIFOR, Bogor 2012. Mapping global tropical wetlands from earth observing satellite imagery.

Presentations

  • Gumbricht, T., NASA 2017. Optical remote sensing of wetlands and lakes, hybrid approaches
  • Roman-Cuesta, R.-M. & Gumbricht, T., COP23, 6-17 November 2017, Bonn, Germany 2017. Monitoring peatland degradation: the case study of the Okavango River Delta, Botswana
  • Gumbricht, T. et al., GSOC17, March 2017, Rome, Italy 2017. An expert approach for identifying and mapping tropical wetlands and peatlands: areas, depths and volumes.
  • Gumbricht, T., CIFOR, September 2014, Bogor, Indonesia 2014. Hybrid mapping of tropical wetlands (movie)
  • Gumbricht, T., CIFOR, March 2014, Bogor, Indonesia 2014. Mapping extent, volume and carbon content of global tropical wetlands
  • Gumbricht, T., FAO, May 2013, Rome, Italy 2013. Mapping global tropical wetlands
  • Gumbricht, T., CIFOR, March 2014, Bogor, Indonesia 2012. Mapping carbon content of global tropical wetlands

Posters

  • Gumbricht, T., Mapping Water Bodies from Space conference 18-19 March 2015, Rome, Italy 2015. Mapping Water Bodies and Wetlands from Multi-Spectral Optical Satellite Images.
